About me

GIS Developer with a strong foundation in GEO-IT, skilled in making sense of spatial data analysis and bringing it to life through web applications. A collaborative professional dedicated to continuous learning, clear communication, and leveraging the latest technology to tackle complex challenges.

  • The People Group

    GIS Developer

    Jan 2023 - Feb 2024

    I played a key role in a project focused on enhancing WebGIS applications. My main contributions were to the development and maintenance of a modular frontend GIS viewer and the creation of a configuration page for easy client customization. This effort was part of a four-person team dedicated to innovating GIS tools, requiring expertise in web development, GIS, Agile methodologies, and technologies like GeoServer and PostGIS.

    • Used TypeScript, React, Leaflet, and Redux to develop a robust WebGIS application, focusing on performance and user experience.
    • Applied Figma and Inkscape to design intuitive and interactive GIS web interfaces, emphasizing usability and aesthetic appeal.
    • Employed Scrum and Azure DevOps for project management, ensuring efficient workflow and team collaboration throughout the development cycle.
    • Administered PostGIS, GeoServer, and Docker to manage spatial data effectively, ensuring data integrity and accessibility.
    • Engaged in the design of new basemaps using the Maputnik editor.

  • GIS Specialisten - TPG

    Web-GIS Developer Intern

    Jun 2021 - Dec 2021

    During my internship as a Web-GIS Developer, I was part of a small development team of 4. My main project focused on spatio-temporal data visualization in a Web-GIS application. The organization identified a need for a tool to represent the temporal dimension of geo-data, given its relevance in multi-temporal spatial datasets.

    • Reviewed literature on Web-GIS and spatio-temporal data visualization and became acquainted with essential tools.
    • Engaged in front-end and back-end development, utilizing React and Redux for UI and state management, Leaflet for mapping, and GeoServer for backend data services.
    • Designed the application with functional, reusable components to incorporate a timeline tool, enhancing scalability and maintainability through modular frontend development.

  • Cartography & GIS Service - Universitat de Lleida

    Junior GIS Technician

    Sep 2017 - Dec 2018

    This role was situated within an academic context, offering support across various geographical and spatial research projects. Our work catered to both internal clients, such as professors from different university departments, and external stakeholders. Working part-time at 20 hours per week, I managed to balance this role with my academic studies, bridging the gap between academic research and real-world GIS applications.

    • I converted traditional maps into digital formats, making sure they were accurate and easy to use.
